name: Kepler-302
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-302 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-302 is a star with 1.454 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.22 times its radius. It is located 4760.70 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-302 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-302 b

Kepler-302 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 30.18 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-302.

The mass of Kepler-302 b is 27.74 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-302 b is 4.06 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-302 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-302 c

Kepler-302 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.50 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 127.28 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-302.

The mass of Kepler-302 c is 409.15 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-302 c is 12.45 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-302 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-302, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
